battle

Class StatusBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • battle.StatusBuilder

  • public class StatusBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Constructs Status objects using a builder pattern. All setter methods return the instance of the object it is called upon. The build method returns a new Status object using the information obtained through defaults and set methods.
    Author:
    Andrew M. Teller(https://github.com/AndrewMiTe)

    • Constructor Detail

      • StatusBuilder

        public StatusBuilder(java.lang.String name)
        Instantiates the object with the name of the Status to be built. Sets all other properties of the status to be built to their default values.
        Parameters:
        name - see setName(java.lang.String). Cannot be null.

      • StatusBuilder

        public StatusBuilder(Status status)
        Instantiates the object by setting all properties so that any status built directly after initialization would be a copy of the Status object given.
        Parameters:
        status - the status used to set all properties.

    • Method Detail

      • build

        public Status build()
        Creates a new Status object built with the values set by this builder object. Default values for all parameters, if not explicitely set, are used with exception to the name parameter, which is set when the StatusBuilder is initiated.
        Returns:
        new Status object built with the values set in this builder object.

      • setName

        public StatusBuilder setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name that identifies the status to be built from unrelated Status objects. The name property has no default value.
        Parameters:
        name - name parameter for producing a Status object. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        this object.

      • setDescription

        public StatusBuilder setDescription(java.lang.String description)
        Sets the description of how the status to be built is intended to interact with Fighter objects it is applied to, as well as its interactions with other Status objects on the same fighter. The default description is an empty string.
        Parameters:
        description - description parameter for producing a Status object. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        this object.

      • setDuration

        public StatusBuilder setDuration(java.time.Duration duration)
        Sets the time before this status expires once it is applied. Zero means the status has an instant duration and should expire as soon as it is applied. Less then zero means duration is infinite. The default duration is instant.
        Parameters:
        duration - duration parameter for producing a Status object. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        this object.

      • setAsInstant

        public StatusBuilder setAsInstant()
        Sets the status to be built so that it would be marked for removal immediately after being applied. This is a convenience method for setting the duration to ZERO.
        Returns:
        this object.

      • setAsInfinite

        public StatusBuilder setAsInfinite()
        Sets this so that the status to be built can not expire due to the passing of time. This is a convenience method for setting the duration to -1 second.
        Returns:
        this object.

      • setStackSize

        public StatusBuilder setStackSize(int stackSize)
        Sets the current number of stacks. The default stack size is 1.
        Parameters:
        stackSize - stack size parameter for producing a Status object. Cannot be < 1.
        Returns:
        this object.

      • setStackable

        public StatusBuilder setStackable(boolean stackable)
        Sets the status to be built so that it can have a stack size greater then 1 when set to true. The default is true.
        Parameters:
        stackable - stackable parameter for producing a Status object.
        Returns:
        this object.

      • setStunning

        public StatusBuilder setStunning(boolean stunning)
        Sets the status to be built so that it can stun the fighter it is applied to when set to true. Stunned fighters do not decrement their skill cooldowns or execute skills for non-stunbreak skills. The default is false.
        Parameters:
        stunning - stunning parameter for producing a Status object.
        Returns:
        this object.
        See Also:
        SkillBuilder.setStunBreak(boolean)

      • setDefeating

        public StatusBuilder setDefeating(boolean defeats)
        Sets the status to be built so that it can defeat the fighter it is applied to when set to true. Defeated Fighter objects allow their team to lose a battle if all other ally fighters are also defeated. Defeated fighters do not decrement their skill cooldowns or execute skills for non-deathless skills. The default is false.
        Parameters:
        defeats - defeats parameter for producing a Status object.
        Returns:
        this object.
        See Also:
        SkillBuilder.setDeathless(boolean)

      • setHidden

        public StatusBuilder setHidden(boolean hidden)
        Sets the status to be built so that it should not be visible to the user of the client when set to true. The default is false.
        Parameters:
        hidden - hidden parameter for producing a Status object.
        Returns:
        this object.

      • setApplyCondition

        public StatusBuilder setApplyCondition(java.util.function.Predicate<Fighter> applyCondition)
        Sets the test condition that returns true if the status can be successfully applied to the target owner of the status to be built. Accepts the target owner of the status as the given parameter. The default condition is a function that returns true.
        Parameters:
        applyCondition - apply condition parameter for producing a Status object. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        this object.

      • setRemoveCondition

        public StatusBuilder setRemoveCondition(java.util.function.Predicate<Fighter> removeCondition)
        Sets the test condition that returns true if the status can be successfully removed from the owner of the status to be built. Accepts the owner of the status as the given parameter. The default condition is a function that returns true.
        Parameters:
        removeCondition - remove condition parameter for producing a Status object. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        this object.

      • addListener

        public StatusBuilder addListener(StatusHandler listener)
        Adds a new StatusHandler object to receive method calls during appropriate events in the skill, such status application and removal.
        Parameters:
        listener - new listener for producing a Status object. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        this object.

      • removeListener

        public boolean removeListener(StatusHandler listener)
        Removes a listener from the list of listeners for producing a Status object.
        Parameters:
        listener - the object to be removed.
        Returns:
        true if the object was successfully removed.
        See Also:
        addListener(battle.StatusHandler)
